beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Mammoth Tuff? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Mammoth Tuff scored 76 out of 100. Elite tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Mammoth Tuff. Mammoth Lakes, California. 100 mi. 100 miles of High Sierra alpine gravel. 7.5 thousand ft elevation, 7.9 thousand to 8 thousand ft altitude. 70% gravel, 30% paved. Smooth fast roads. Technical rating: 2/5. Altitude is the defining challenge.
beats.text_on_screen: Mammoth Tuff | Mammoth Lakes, California | 100 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Altitude. 5 out of 5. Oxygen is a luxury item at this elevation. Starting at 8,000 feet in Mammoth Lakes with riding throughout the high volcanic tableland creates race-defining oxygen debt. Race Quality. 5 out of 5. Best-in-class race production. Three staggered distance starts with proper aid station support and detailed course guides via Ride w GPS. Experience. 5 out of 5. Once-in-a-lifetime course experience. Racing through a volcanic caldera formed 760,000 years ago isn't your typical weekend gravel grind. Length. 4 out of 5. This is a long day. Plan accordingly. The TUFFEST at 105 miles and TUFFER at 75 miles provide proper distance challenge without ultra-endurance excess. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Your power-to-weight ratio matters here. The TUFFEST delivers 7,500 feet over 105 miles with the hardest climbing back-loaded. Adventure. 4 out of 5. The kind of ride you'll tell stories about. Racing through Long Valley Caldera formed 760,000 years ago on volcanic stone gravel delivers proper wilderness experience. Prestige. 4 out of 5. Prestigious. People plan seasons around it. UCI Gravel World Series qualifier with top 3 per category and top 25% of Elite earning Worlds spots. Community. 4 out of 5. Strong community. This race builds friendships. TUFF Ventures has built what they call 'TUFF community' around the volcanic suffering, complete with a post-race BUFF Beer Mile.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Field Depth. 4 out of 5. Stacked field. Fast riders everywhere. Value. 4 out of 5. Strong value proposition. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Gets the job done. Nothing fancy. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mostly pleasant. Check the forecast anyway.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: UCI Altitude Test in the High Sierra. Show up fit or the 8 thousand-foot starting elevation will expose every training shortcut you took. The 7.5 thousand feet of climbing over 105 miles isn't negotiable, and volcanic gravel punishes both your legs and your equipment. This isn't a scenic tour. it's a legitimate training ground that's produced Unbound winners for a reason.
beats.text_on_screen: UCI Altitude Test in the High Sierra — 76/100
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Mammoth Tuff isn't quite right for you. Belgian Waffle Ride delivers similar suffer-per-mile ratios with more technical variety, while Crusher in the Tushar offers comparable high-altitude punishment with Utah's signature loose climbs. Both skip the volcanic rock tax but demand the same honest fitness.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.
